item.title: Lena add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "Soon someone would say the fatal words, "Well, I think itâ€™s time for me to go to bed." -- Evelyn Waugh

item.title: Lena add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For the young people could not talk. And why should they? Shout, embrace, swing, be up at dawn..." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Lena add a quote by Thomas Mann
item.description: "Solitude produces originality, bold and astonishing beauty, poetry. But solitude also produces perverseness, the disproportianate, the absurd and the forbidden." -- Thomas Mann

item.title: Lena add a quote by Anna Gavalda
item.description: "How could you let yourself be sidetracked while I was waiting for your breath on my back?" -- Anna Gavalda

item.title: Lena add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "They learned to hate her unknowability, her untouchability, the collage of her." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Lena add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "Be thankful that you have a life, and forsake your vain and presumptuous desire for a second one." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Lena add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Don't let the bastards grind you down." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Lena add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Stupidity is the same as evil if you judge by the results." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Lena add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "As your lover describes you, so you are." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Lena add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "Usually adult males who are unable to make emotional connections with the women they choose to be intimate with are frozen in time, unable to allow themselves to love for fear that the loved one will abandon them. If the first woman they passionately loved, the mother, was not true to her bond of love, then how can they trust that their partner will be true to love. Often in their adult relationships these men act out again and again to test their partner's love. While the rejected adolescent boy imagines that he can no longer receive his mother's love because he is not worthy, as a grown man he may act out in ways that are unworthy and yet demand of the woman in his life that she offer him unconditional love. This testing does not heal the wound of the past, it merely reenacts it, for ultimately the woman will become weary of being tested and end the relationship, thus reenacting the abandonment. This drama confirms for many men that they cannot put their trust in love. They decide that it is better to put their faith in being powerful, in being dominant." -- bell hooks
